intro: Rhodiola bupleuroides, commonly known as the Siberian rhodiola, is a perennial herb native to the cold regions of Asia and Europe. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments. Rhodiola bupleuroides is known for its medicinal properties and has been traditionally used in herbal medicine.
